intro: Sagraea grisebachii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre daisy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Sagraea grisebachii is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
